1.text: Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but he who hates correction is stupid.

2.text: The good man obtains favor from the LORD, but the LORD condemns a man who devises evil.

3.text: A man cannot be established through wickedness, but the righteous cannot be uprooted.

4.text: A wife of noble character is her husband’s crown, but she who causes shame is like decay in his bones.

5.text: The plans of the righteous are just, but the counsel of the wicked leads to deceit.

6.text: The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood, but the speech of the upright rescues them.

7.text: The wicked are overthrown and perish, but the house of the righteous will stand.

8.text: A man is praised according to his wisdom, but a twisted mind is despised.

9.text: Better to be lightly esteemed yet have a servant, than to be self-important but lack food.

10.text: A righteous man regards the life of his animal, but the tender mercies of the wicked are only cruelty.

11.text: The one who works his land will have plenty of food, but whoever chases fantasies lacks judgment.

12.text: The wicked desire the plunder of evil men, but the root of the righteous flourishes.

13.text: An evil man is trapped by his rebellious speech, but a righteous man escapes from trouble.

14.text: By fruitful speech a man is filled with good things, and the work of his hands returns to him.

15.text: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but a wise man listens to counsel.

16.text: A fool’s anger is known at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult.

17.text: He who speaks the truth declares what is right, but a false witness speaks deceit.

18.text: Speaking rashly is like a piercing sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing.

19.text: Truthful lips endure forever, but a lying tongue lasts only a moment.

20.text: Deceit is in the hearts of those who devise evil, but the counselors of peace have joy.

21.text: No harm befalls the righteous, but the wicked are filled with trouble.

22.text: Lying lips are detestable to the LORD, but those who deal faithfully are His delight.

23.text: A shrewd man keeps his knowledge to himself, but a foolish heart proclaims its folly.

24.text: The hand of the diligent will rule, but laziness ends in forced labor.

25.text: Anxiety weighs down the heart of a man, but a good word cheers it up.

26.text: A righteous man is cautious in friendship, but the ways of the wicked lead them astray.

27.text: A lazy man does not roast his game, but a diligent man prizes his possession.

28.text: There is life in the path of righteousness, but another path leads to death.
